intro: Tritonia stricta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tritonia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its tuberous roots and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in spring and are followed by narrow, grass-like leaves. Tritonia stricta is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained conditions.
